Highlights

  • MIND launches Data Loss Prevention (DLP) for Agentic AI to Secure Data Used by Autonomous Systems (2026-01-28)

    MIND has announced a new DLP solution focused on agentic AI. As agentic AI is deployed in mission-critical, sensitive functions like HR and payroll, risks around data privacy and governance grow. The DLP platform embeds monitoring and enterprise-grade controls designed for autonomous systems, which is increasingly relevant for Workday and other SaaS HR platforms. This launch directly addresses security and compliance demands from highly regulated clients, making it crucial for Deloitte’s Workday advisors to incorporate such DLP capabilities into transformation conversations. Read more

  • Teleport Launches Agentic Identity Framework for Secure AI Agent Management (2026-01-27)

    Teleport released its Agentic Identity Framework, enabling persistent, traceable identity management for enterprise AI agents and digital assistants. As organizations deploy agentic AI in operational processes, enterprise leaders are demanding robust audit trails, granular access control, and verified agent actions. The framework supports secure, compliant agentic AI deployments within complex SaaS stacks (like Workday), representing a pivotal evolution for clients in regulated sectors. Deloitte teams can use this as a differentiator and reassurance in client engagements. Details here

  • Workday’s Conversational AI Transforms Complexity for Global Healthcare Giant (Workday/Medtronic Case Study)

    Workday's partnership with Medtronic offers a showcase for deploying AI-driven digital assistants in a demanding healthcare environment. The transformation highlights Workday's strengths in integrating complex, multi-jurisdictional data, automating key workflows, and enhancing employee experiences while remaining compliant with sector regulations. This case is a potent resource for Deloitte teams engaging with large healthcare or regulated clients, providing a roadmap for successful HCM modernization. See the case study

Competitive Watch

  • ADP

    ADP continues to market its AI agent capabilities for payroll and HR automation, focusing on productivity gains, event-driven automation, and regulatory compliance. This intensifies competition for Workday in the intelligent automation and agent enablement segments. Deloitte’s teams must clearly articulate the governance and integration advantages of the Workday ecosystem compared to AI “point” solutions. Learn more

  • Teleport

    Teleport’s Agentic Identity Framework sets a new governance and compliance benchmark by giving autonomous digital agents their own auditable identities. This move will drive client expectation for similarly granular controls in all SaaS HR implementations, including those leveraging Workday and consulting partners like Deloitte. More here

  • MIND

    By launching focused DLP services for agentic AI, MIND meets heightened client demand for data lifecycle risk management in autonomous digital operations. As organizations consider migrating sensitive workflows to autonomous SaaS, Workday stakeholders and Deloitte practices should prioritize similar data safeguards. Reference

Enablement

  • Secure AI agent identity and access governance: Teleport’s Agentic Identity Framework enables Workday consultants to help clients securely scale agentic workflows, with persistent identity and access controls ensuring trust and compliance.
  • Deploying safe, compliant agentic AI in HR: MIND DLP for Agentic AI allows teams to design HR transformations that are compliant from the outset. Mastery of DLP for AI will be foundational over the next quarter.
  • Sector-specific AI transformation (Healthcare HCM): Leverage the Medtronic-Workday deployment as a sectoral case study for engaging complex, regulated clients and driving modernized, trustworthy HCM solutioning.

Actions for Next Week

  • Host a client enablement session on agentic AI compliance and governance based on identity/DLP frameworks.
  • Create sector-focused materials illustrating safe, successful AI deployments for regulated industries, led by the Medtronic-Workday case.
  • Review alliance and third-party options to enhance Workday HCM’s agentic security via identity and DLP innovations.
  • Align RFP and advisory documents with the latest AI agent controls and regulatory expectations.

Risks & Mitigations

  • Agentic AI increases risk of data leakage/audit failure in HR SaaS.
    Mitigate by upskilling consulting and client teams on new DLP and identity frameworks, embedding compliance from inception.
  • Clients may favor competitors or third-party solutions if Workday’s AI safety/gov features aren’t explicit.
    Mitigate by clarifying Workday and Deloitte’s position as proactive leaders in risk-aware, compliance-aligned AI deployments.
  • AI adoption could stall in healthcare or regulated sectors due to privacy uncertainty.
    Mitigate through detailed, relatable sector case studies showing successful, compliant deployments.

All Sources

  • MIND launches DLP for Agentic AI to secure data used by autonomous systems
  • Teleport launches Agentic Identity Framework to secure AI agents in production
  • Turning Complexity into Clarity for Global Healthcare Giant (Workday/Medtronic Case Study)
  • Artificial Intelligence (AI) Agents for Payroll & HR (ADP)

Return JSON ONLY in this exact shape (no code fences, no extra text):

{
  "type": "daily or weekly",
  "run_date": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "title": "Short headline",
  "priority_focus": "1–2 sentences on what matters most now",
  "highlights": [
    { "headline": "…", "why_it_matters": "…", "source_url": "https://…" }
  ],
  "competitive_watch": [
    { "competitor": "Name", "move": "…", "implication": "…" }
  ],
  "enablement": [
    { "skill": "Topic", "resource_url": "https://…", "90_day_outcome": "…" }
  ],
  "actions_next_week": ["…"],
  "risks": [
    { "risk": "…", "mitigation": "…" }
  ],
  "sources": [
    { "title": "…", "url": "https://…" }
  ],
  "html_body": "<h2>…</h2> (well-formatted HTML with <a href="https://…">links</a>; no scripts/external CSS)",
  "plain_text_body": "Text-only with visible URLs"
}

Parameters:
- Set "run_date" to TODAY_ET = 2026-01-28.
- For DAILY: set "type":"daily"; target ~1000 words; STRICTLY restrict to the last 24 hours (from 2026-01-27T06:44 to 2026-01-28T06:44); include publication dates in highlight text.
- For WEEKLY: set "type":"weekly"; target 2000–2500 words; restrict to 2026-01-21…2026-01-28; include <h3>What changed this week</h3> and publication dates in highlight text.
- Section order for html_body: Highlights; Competitive Watch; Enablement; Actions for Next Week; Risks & Mitigations; All Sources.
- Every item must include at least one absolute URL (https://…).
- Keep total HTML under ~25KB.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS
- For every highlight and competitive_watch item, include a 2–3 paragraph detailed summary within the "why_it_matters" text.
- Where relevant, compare perspectives across multiple sources.
- Include a clear "so what" statement for Deloitte’s Workday practice.
- Ensure all cited URLs appear in the `sources` array and inside the `html_body` link text.
- Keep factual accuracy and avoid speculation.

As organizations deploy agentic AI in operational processes, enterprise leaders are demanding robust audit trails, granular access control, and verified agent actions. The framework supports secure, compliant agentic AI deployments within complex SaaS stacks (like Workday), representing a pivotal evolution for clients in regulated sectors. Deloitte teams can use this as a differentiator and reassurance in client engagements. <a href=\\\"https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/27/teleport-launches-agentic-identity-framework-secure-ai-agents-production\\\">Details here</a></p>\\n  </li>\\n  <li><b>Workday’s Conversational AI Transforms Complexity for Global Healthcare Giant (Workday/Medtronic Case Study)</b><br/>\\n    <p>Workday's partnership with Medtronic offers a showcase for deploying AI-driven digital assistants in a demanding healthcare environment. The transformation highlights Workday's strengths in integrating complex, multi-jurisdictional data, automating key workflows, and enhancing employee experiences while remaining compliant with sector regulations. This case is a potent resource for Deloitte teams engaging with large healthcare or regulated clients, providing a roadmap for successful HCM modernization. <a href=\\\"https://www.workday.com/en-us/customer-stories/i-p/medtronic-complexity-into-clarity-conversational-ai.html\\\">See the case study</a></p>\\n  </li>\\n</ul>\\n\\n<h2>Competitive Watch</h2>\\n<ul>\\n  <li><b>ADP</b><br/>\\n    <p>ADP continues to market its AI agent capabilities for payroll and HR automation, focusing on productivity gains, event-driven automation, and regulatory compliance. This intensifies competition for Workday in the intelligent automation and agent enablement segments. Deloitte’s teams must clearly articulate the governance and integration advantages of the Workday ecosystem compared to AI “point” solutions. <a href=\\\"https://www.adp.com/what-we-offer/ai-solutions/ai-agents.aspx\\\">Learn more</a></p>\\n  </li>\\n  <li><b>Teleport</b><br/>\\n    <p>Teleport’s Agentic Identity Framework sets a new governance and compliance benchmark by giving autonomous digital agents their own auditable identities. This move will drive client expectation for similarly granular controls in all SaaS HR implementations, including those leveraging Workday and consulting partners like Deloitte. <a href=\\\"https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/27/teleport-launches-agentic-identity-framework-secure-ai-agents-production\\\">More here</a></p>\\n  </li>\\n  <li><b>MIND</b><br/>\\n    <p>By launching focused DLP services for agentic AI, MIND meets heightened client demand for data lifecycle risk management in autonomous digital operations. As organizations consider migrating sensitive workflows to autonomous SaaS, Workday stakeholders and Deloitte practices should prioritize similar data safeguards. <a href=\\\"https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/28/mind-launches-dlp-agentic-ai-secure-data-used-autonomous-systems\\\">Reference</a></p>\\n  </li>\\n</ul>\\n\\n<h2>Enablement</h2>\\n<ul>\\n  <li><b>Secure AI agent identity and access governance</b>: <a href=\\\"https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/27/teleport-launches-agentic-identity-framework-secure-ai-agents-production\\\">Teleport’s Agentic Identity Framework</a> enables Workday consultants to help clients securely scale agentic workflows, with persistent identity and access controls ensuring trust and compliance.</li>\\n  <li><b>Deploying safe, compliant agentic AI in HR</b>: <a href=\\\"https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/28/mind-launches-dlp-agentic-ai-secure-data-used-autonomous-systems\\\">MIND DLP for Agentic AI</a> allows teams to design HR transformations that are compliant from the outset. Mastery of DLP for AI will be foundational over the next quarter.</li>\\n  <li><b>Sector-specific AI transformation (Healthcare HCM)</b>: Leverage <a href=\\\"https://www.workday.com/en-us/customer-stories/i-p/medtronic-complexity-into-clarity-conversational-ai.html\\\">the Medtronic-Workday deployment</a> as a sectoral case study for engaging complex, regulated clients and driving modernized, trustworthy HCM solutioning.</li>\\n</ul>\\n\\n<h2>Actions for Next Week</h2>\\n<ul>\\n  <li>Host a client enablement session on agentic AI compliance and governance based on identity/DLP frameworks.</li>\\n  <li>Create sector-focused materials illustrating safe, successful AI deployments for regulated industries, led by the Medtronic-Workday case.</li>\\n  <li>Review alliance and third-party options to enhance Workday HCM’s agentic security via identity and DLP innovations.</li>\\n  <li>Align RFP and advisory documents with the latest AI agent controls and regulatory expectations.</li>\\n</ul>\\n\\n<h2>Risks & Mitigations</h2>\\n<ul>\\n  <li><b>Agentic AI increases risk of data leakage/audit failure in HR SaaS.</b> <br/>Mitigate by upskilling consulting and client teams on new DLP and identity frameworks, embedding compliance from inception.</li>\\n  <li><b>Clients may favor competitors or third-party solutions if Workday’s AI safety/gov features aren’t explicit.</b> <br/>Mitigate by clarifying Workday and Deloitte’s position as proactive leaders in risk-aware, compliance-aligned AI deployments.</li>\\n  <li><b>AI adoption could stall in healthcare or regulated sectors due to privacy uncertainty.</b> <br/>Mitigate through detailed, relatable sector case studies showing successful, compliant deployments.</li>\\n</ul>\\n\\n<h2>All Sources</h2>\\n<ul>\\n  <li><a href=\\\"https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/28/mind-launches-dlp-agentic-ai-secure-data-used-autonomous-systems\\\">MIND launches DLP for Agentic AI to secure data used by autonomous systems</a></li>\\n  <li><a production</a></li>\\n  <li><a href=\\\"https://www.workday.com/en-us/customer-stories/i-p/medtronic-complexity-into-clarity-conversational-ai.html\\\">Turning Complexity into Clarity for Global       "title": "90% of US companies say they missed their hiring goals in ...",
      "content": "### Dive Brief:\n\n Ninety percent of U.S. companies said they missed their hiring goals, with 1 in 3 reporting they missed those goals by a wide margin, according to the fifth annual Hiring Insights Report from recruiting software company GoodTime.\n The independent study, which surveyed more than 500 U.S. talent acquisition leaders at companies with more than 1,000 employees in November 2025, found that recruiters spend 38% of their time scheduling interviews, meaning “scheduling remains the biggest operational tax on hiring,” per the report.\n While 99.8% of TA teams said they either use or plan to use AI agents, the report noted an uptick in “fraudulent” or AI-assisted candidates — making fraud the most anticipated hiring challenge in 2026.\n\n### Dive Insight: [...] ### Dive Insight:\n\nThe hiring market is under an “unprecedented strain,” GoodTime researchers said, with 60% of organizations seeing time-to-hire increase in 2025, and only 1 in 9 companies saying they had reduced time-to-hire. Likewise, a June report from Robert Half found that 93% of hiring managers said the hiring process took longer in 2025 than just two years ago.\n\nThe report from GoodTime outlined what kind of AI use in hiring could be useful to recruiters. Top-performing TA teams reorganized roles and workflows around AI instead of adding recruiters or relying on top-of-funnel automation, per the report.       "title": "Teradata Unveils Enterprise AgentStack to Accelerate Agentic AI",
      "content": "### Teradata Unveils Enterprise AgentStack to Accelerate Agentic AI. SAN DIEGO , Jan. 27, 2026 /PRNewswire/ -- Teradata (NYSE: TDC) today announced Enterprise AgentStack, designed to help enterprises to move from isolated pilots to production-grade autonomy quickly, even across multi-agent and hybrid environments. **Product Description**Teradata Enterprise AgentStack is an open and connected stack that unifies the AI agent lifecycle to deliver production-ready agents with context and interoperability across hybrid environments. Unlike fragmented solutions, Teradata delivers production-ready agents, backed by integrated security, governance, and context. Agents access Teradata's context intelligence—industry data models, frameworks, and expert prompts—combined with tools from cloud service providers, NVIDIA, and open LLM APIs. Pre-built agents include Customer Lifetime Value, SQL optimization, data science workflows, and system monitoring. By pairing Teradata's analytic performance and trusted data foundation with our no-code agentic AI platform, organizations can transform static data into dynamic, intelligent workflows. It provides ready-to-use components for discovering, orchestrating, and integrating mission-critical Teradata data into agent workflows—enabling fast, secure, context-rich interactions between AI models and Teradata's analytics and AI platform.",

He says this is an incredible win to have these built into the Workday platform.\n\n## Because progress starts with people.\n\nFor Sethi, Medtronic’s AI transformation is successful only if it remains human-centric. This means upskilling the workforce alongside the technology deployment. AI is not about remediating people, but about giving them new pathways for development, new skills, and new toolkits.\n\n## Because progress starts with people. [...] The Paradox platform also took over the administrative burden of coordinating interviews among candidates, recruiters, internal teams, and hiring managers, eliminating the lengthy back-and-forth and freeing up time to pursue higher-value work.\n\nSethi views this automation as the \"magic sauce\" for employee upskilling and strategic focus.  “We see AI as a partner—it handles the routine tasks, freeing up our people to be more strategic,” he says.\n\nThe next wave for Medtronic will be agentic, with Sethi excited for native, data-connected Workday AI agents for recruiting, talent, and onboarding. He says this is an incredible win to have these built into the Workday platform.\n\n## Automating the manual, augmenting the human. [...] Paramount to this vision is that it is human-led. For Sethi, AI is a companion, but will never be a human replacement. He believes AI governance and ethical and emotional decision-making are distinctly human strengths. Sethi knew driving AI innovation for the organization and employees required cutting edge technology. Critical to this AI journey was unlocking capabilities with Workday AI and Workday-acquired Paradox.\n\n## Automating the manual, augmenting the human.\n\nThe company streamlined two unique cases with AI-powered conversational recruiting software from Paradox.       "url": "https://venturebeat.com/technology/the-ai-visualization-tech-stack-from-2d-to-holograms",
      "title": "The AI visualization tech stack: From 2D to holograms",
      "content": "The first use cases are those in which the consequences of a bad decision are life-threatening, typically in medical and defence applications. The cognitive load and side effects of individual solutions are too much to accept in these situations. But physical AI is quickly encroaching into these high-consequence areas. Autonomous systems are driving our cars, running our factories, and are moving into these high-consequence areas that already demand human-in-the-loop decisions. Holograms allow teams to use their own spatial reasoning to identify simulation-to-reality gaps that may be invisible in other mediums.\n\n## The future of the visualization stack [...] #### 1. The 2D screen: the precision desktop\n\nThe 2D screen has been the reliable workhorse since spatial computing started and continues to be the primary interface, with most professional work still happening here. For a developer training a model or a single user doing 3D modeling, the 2D screen is great for the individual contributor. However, using a 2D screen forces a “3D-to-2D” mental translation, where the user has to keep the model in their mind, rotating, zooming, and interacting with this specific corner of the spatial world. The cognitive load of this mental model can cause the brain to work overtime to understand it.\n\n#### 2. VR: the immersive workspace [...] #### 2. VR: the immersive workspace\n\nVR offers that first jump beyond 2D. By completely immersing yourself in the 3D world, you gain a capability that is accessible and effective. When training a robotic system, being in the place of the autonomous system, helping that system by showing the human movement and training the system, VR is the place to be. But you are inherently by yourself. Even with avatars, you’ve lost touch with reality; only the digital world exists.\n\n#### 3. AR: the expert in your ear",

      "title": "Anthropic integrates third‑party apps into Claude, reshaping ...",
      "content": "While Anthropic and OpenAI are building models in which applications run inside the AI interface, other big tech vendors, including Microsoft and Google, are focused on embedding AI directly into their productivity suites, such as Microsoft 365 Copilot and Google Gemini Workspace, Dutt said.\n\n“These strategies represent two paths toward a similar end state. As enterprise demand for agent-driven execution grows, in a separate layer, it is likely that these approaches will converge, with Microsoft and Google eventually supporting more interactive, app-level execution models as well,” Dutt added.\n\nFurther, the analyst pointed out that Claude’s new interactive apps will also facilitate easier governance and trust — key facets of scaling agentic AI systems in an enterprise.       "url": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/prescriptive-guidance/latest/patterns/deploy-lambda-functions-with-container-images.html",
      "title": "Deploy Lambda functions with container images",
      "content": "| Task | Description | Skills required |\n --- \n| Create a Git repository. | Create a Git repository that will contain the application source code, the Dockerfile, and the `buildspec.yaml` file. | Developer | [...] Lambda is a serverless, event-driven compute service that you can use to run code for virtually any type of application or backend service without provisioning or managing servers. With container image support for Lambda functions, you get the benefits of up to 10 GB of storage for your application artifact and the ability to use familiar container image development tools.\n\nThe example in this pattern uses Python as the underlying programming language, but you can use other languages, such as Java, Node.js, or Go. For the source, consider a Git-based system such as GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket, or use Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3).\n\n## Prerequisites and limitations [...] Document Conventions\n\nCreate an Amazon ECS task definition on EC2 instances using Amazon EFS\n\nDeploy Java microservices on Amazon ECS using AWS Fargate\n\nDid this page help you? - Yes\n\nThanks for letting us know we're doing a good job!\n\nIf you've got a moment, please tell us what we did right so we can do more of it.\n\nDid this page help you? - No\n\nThanks for letting us know this page needs work.       "content": "# AI-Powered UKG Pro HCM Suite Built to Create Great Workplaces. *Highly anticipated launch of UKG Great Place To Work Hub and introduction of enhanced Pro suite mobile experience cap off exciting innovations introduced at UKG Aspire*. **UKG**, a leading provider of HR, payroll, and workforce management solutions for all people, this week announced the highly anticipated availability of the UKG Great Place To Work® Hub to all UKG Pro customers. The **Great Place To Work Hub**is an industry-first solution that transforms HR metrics into opportunities for equity, belonging, and creating great leaders. **Leveraging generative AI** (GenAI) trained on three decades of Trust Index™ benchmarks, insights, and best practices from Great Place To Work available only to UKG, the Great Place To Work Hub provides organizations with actionable insights to become a great workplace, connecting culture to business outcomes. It coaches HR leaders and people managers with AI-powered recommendations and nudges toward specific actions and behaviors, helping them advance along the Great Place To Work “For All” leadership model. “When you take the rich Great Place To Work data and intersect it with the UKG Pro HCM suite, magic begins to happen — with next-generation insights that help organizations become a ‘For All’ company,” Brian K. Reaves, chief belonging, equity, and impact officer at UKG, told more than 5,000 people gathered for UKG Aspire to celebrate the impact of technology on building great workplaces. By combining both Pro and **UKG Pro Workforce Management** into a single, unified app, all users will enjoy the same intuitive, easy-to-use experience, regardless of whether they need to complete HR-, payroll-, or workforce management-specific actions. * **UKG Bryte**, an AI-powered assistant for great workplaces that uses GenAI to help guide employees, people managers, and HR leaders by shining a light on important insights that support great workplace cultures.       "content": "Dayforce HCM is a cloud solution for Payroll, Benefits, Workforce Management, Human Resources, Talent Management, Document Management, and Analytics. Built on a single database with one rule engine, Dayforce HCM enables organizations to find and hire the right people, process pay, manage benefits enrollment, maintain HR records, and schedule staff while monitoring compliance throughout the employee lifecycle. Predictive Analytics allows flight-risk data to be embedded throughout the application for easy access and at no additional cost. This new capability applies machine learning algorithms to employee data, giving managers and executives a new tool to evaluate employee flight risk and identify and address reasons contributing to employee turnover. [...] “Dayforce HCM has consistently ranked as the leading Leader in our Human Capital Management Value Matrix,” says Brent Skinner, Principal Analyst at Nucleus Research. “This is thanks to Ceridian’s commitment to innovation as they bring full HCM into a single application, with a single dataset governed by a single rules engine. The addition of Predictive Analytics will give Dayforce users the ability to unlock the power of that single dataset for all of HCM. We expect that users will find this new functionality furthering their ability lower costs, boost productivity, improve employee engagement, and reduce turnover.”\n\nFor more information about Predictive Analytics and the entire Dayforce HCM platform, visit www.ceridian.ca.\n\n## You may also like:\n\nView All\n\n Why Dayforce?",

      "content": "# HR Service Delivery (HRSD): A Smarter Way to Support Employees\n\nUmesH77\n\n3 weeks ago\n - last edited \n\n3 weeks ago\n\nIn today’s digital workplace, employees expect HR services to be fast, transparent, and easy to access. Traditional HR models that rely on emails, spreadsheets, and manual coordination often lead to delays and frustration. This is where Human Resource Service Delivery (HRSD) plays a crucial role.\n\nHRSD helps organizations modernize HR operations by delivering employee services through a single, unified platform.\n\n## What is Human Resource Service Delivery (HRSD)?\n\nHuman Resource Service Delivery (HRSD) is a structured approach to delivering HR services efficiently using automation, workflows, and self-service capabilities.\n\nWith ServiceNow HRSD, employees can: [...] With ServiceNow HRSD, employees can:\n\nSubmit HR requests\n\nAccess HR knowledge articles\n\nTrack request status\n\nCommunicate with HR teams\n\nInstead of employees searching for the right HR contact, HRSD provides one central channel for all HR-related needs.                                                                                                          UmesH77_2-1767673490576.jpeg\n\nUmesH77_2-1767673490576.jpeg\n\n## Why HRSD is Important for Organizations\n\nHRSD directly impacts both employee experience and business productivity.\n\nKey benefits include:\n\nImproved employee engagement\n\nFaster HR case resolution\n\nReduced manual effort for HR teams\n\nBetter collaboration across HR, IT, Finance, and Facilities\n\nConsistent and compliant HR service delivery [...] Consistent and compliant HR service delivery\n\nWhen HR services are simple and reliable, employees spend less time following up and more time focusing on their core responsibilities.\n\n## Real-Life HRSD Use Case\n\nPayroll Query Example\n\nAn employee has a payroll-related issue but doesn’t know which team handles it.  \nWithout HRSD, the request may move between multiple teams, causing delays.\n\nWith HRSD:\n\nThe employee submits a payroll request through the HR portal\n\nThe case is automatically routed to the correct team\n\nStatus updates and SLAs are tracked centrally\n\nThis ensures faster resolution and a better employee experience.\n\n## Key Features of ServiceNow HRSD\n\n### HR Case & Knowledge Management",

This new SKU is purpose-built for the HR agent persona and is a complimentary add-on to our HR Service Delivery product.       "content": "# Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. Role description: Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. This role is a functional and technical expert consulting with corporations on their digital transformation journey powered by implementing ServiceNow’s Employee Service Management Solutions, which includes HR Service Delivery (HRSD), and Workplace/Facility Service Delivery (WSD) solutions. This Advisor role will be the SME within ServiceNow Expert Services (who provide product expertise, in partnership with ServiceNow Product Management), providing expert advisory and building strong executive client relationships within the framework of a strategic program or project with ServiceNow implementing these solutions. * Serve as primary executive point-of-contact on projects, focused on improvements in the client’s Human Resources and Workplace organizations using ServiceNow’s Employee Service Management, HRSD, and WSD Solutions. * Understand customer requirements in collaboration with ServiceNow Expert Services and align them with ServiceNow Expert Services, Product Excellence, Customer Success, and Client Sales Teams to drive high-value impact for the Client in a roadmap for the current engagement, and the Client’s roadmap beyond it. * Align Client to defined roadmap and report/monitor ongoing progress against it, managing client executives and stakeholders – in partnership with ServiceNow Expert Services – to mitigate blockers to drive success, keeping the in-progress engagement on track. * Define, at a solution and design level of detail, technical and functional solutions aligned with our client’s business problems and ServiceNow Implementation Best Practices, providing options with pros, cons, and risks. * Build and nurture strong, trusted advisory relationships with client executives and stakeholders in the client’s Human Resources and Workplace organizations, facilitating effective communication and collaboration between their corporation and ServiceNow. * Advocate for the continuous improvement and adoption of ServiceNow Employee Service Management and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. * 10+ years of management consulting experience or equivalent role repeatedly championing/implementing ServiceNow HR Service Delivery (HRSD) with various organizations.       "content": "# Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. Role description: Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. This role is a functional and technical expert consulting with corporations on their digital transformation journey powered by implementing ServiceNow’s Employee Service Management Solutions, which includes HR Service Delivery (HRSD), and Workplace/Facility Service Delivery (WSD) solutions. This Advisor role will be the SME within ServiceNow Expert Services (who provide product expertise, in partnership with ServiceNow Product Management), providing expert advisory and building strong executive client relationships within the framework of a strategic program or project with ServiceNow implementing these solutions. * Serve as primary executive point-of-contact on projects, focused on improvements in the client’s Human Resources and Workplace organizations using ServiceNow’s Employee Service Management, HRSD, and WSD Solutions. * Understand customer requirements in collaboration with ServiceNow Expert Services and align them with ServiceNow Expert Services, Product Excellence, Customer Success, and Client Sales Teams to drive high-value impact for the Client in a roadmap for the current engagement, and the Client’s roadmap beyond it. * Align Client to defined roadmap and report/monitor ongoing progress against it, managing client executives and stakeholders – in partnership with ServiceNow Expert Services – to mitigate blockers to drive success, keeping the in-progress engagement on track. * Define, at a solution and design level of detail, technical and functional solutions aligned with our client’s business problems and ServiceNow Implementation Best Practices, providing options with pros, cons, and risks. * Build and nurture strong, trusted advisory relationships with client executives and stakeholders in the client’s Human Resources and Workplace organizations, facilitating effective communication and collaboration between their corporation and ServiceNow. * Advocate for the continuous improvement and adoption of ServiceNow Employee Service Management and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. * 10+ years of management consulting experience or equivalent role repeatedly championing/implementing ServiceNow HR Service Delivery (HRSD) with various organizations. [...] There’s a lot of enthusiasm around what AI can do for work: faster answers, greater efficiency, new levels of productivity. In equal measure, there’s an underlying question: Are we designing workplaces that bring us together, or pull us further apart?\n\nThis tension guided a thoughtful conversation on the Future of Work podcast between Workday Chief Learning Officer Chris Ernst and Chief Philanthropy Officer Carrie Varoquiers. The next evolution of human resources (HR):Generative AI (GenAI) has already begun reshaping HR processes and functions in mining and metals, but the next horizon - agentic AI - will likely require a rethink of how work is structured, how roles are defined, and how humans and digital agents collaborate. For Chief Human Resource Officers (CHROs), this is not just a technology challenge but a leadership imperative. By balancing their responsibilities as business owners, workforce leaders, and people stewards, they can harness AI’s potential while keeping humans at the centre. [...] 6. AI for operational excellence:AI is rapidly becoming a foundation for operational excellence for mining and metals operations, helping companies realise productivity uplifts while prioritising safety, addressing workforce gaps, safeguarding operations against cyberthreats and more. Companies that deploy AI strategically, rather than tactically, could find themselves better positioned to anticipate risks, protect their people, and seize emerging opportunities.       "title": "Three Key Trends Likely to Shape Medtech in 2026",
      "content": "The medtech industry is witnessing a transformative shift as AI becomes integral to innovation and operational strategies (see Can agentic AI improve workflows and margins in medtech?). AI can be more than a technology investment. It can be a core capability that can drive advancements across the organization. Many medtech companies are embedding AI across their operations, transforming how they deliver care and how they operate their businesses. However, execution and adoption across the industry remains uneven, with significant challenges in data quality, regulatory compliance, and change management.vii As such, some industry leaders are focusing on investments in critical enablers first—including data governance, talent, and robust processes—to establish a strong foundation to fully [...] Our analysis: AI capability is rapidly becoming the primary competitive differentiator in medtech. The gap between leaders and laggards will likely compound over time as data and processes mature, as talent grows, and as organizational learning expands. This could also accelerate consolidation as companies that lack the resources needed to build comprehensive AI capabilities become acquisition targets. A key determinant of success might be the ability to balance speed with responsibility. Companies should try to move fast enough to avoid competitive obsolescence while maintaining governance rigor that ensures patient safety, data privacy, and regulatory compliance. AI systems should be designed for quality and should also be easily auditable. An effective AI strategy should include clear [...] auditable. An effective AI strategy should include clear problem statements, explicit regulatory and privacy inputs, documented verification and validation protocols, and formalized human roles. This can make it easier for auditors to trace how AI outputs are reviewed before they affect patients or regulatory submissions. Success will also likely depend on centralizing and standardizing core business processes to enable scalable AI solutions in what has traditionally been a highly decentralized sector. Treating data as a governed and shared asset, solving interoperability and ownership issues, and partnering with big tech on infrastructure—while keeping sensitive data inside the organization’s walls—could be important for effectively and compliantly scaling the use of AI and other",

Workday’s Agent System of Record helps customers establish governance and oversight around the work AI agents are doing, allowing them to scale intelligent workflows with confidence. Workday highlights that responsible AI acceleration requires combining powerful automation with a shared control plan — making the secure, compliant path the easiest one, and enabling organizations to scale without losing oversight. [...] ## The human side of digital change.\n\nThe greatest push for this AI future started on the HR side with Workday Human Capital Management with the intent to transform the employee journey from hiring to development and departure. Medtronic set a goal to automate 80% of HR processes. “We can advance the way we provide service to our organization by embedding AI into nearly all the processes that we run for HR,” says Sethi. [...] Paramount to this vision is that it is human-led. For Sethi, AI is a companion, but will never be a human replacement. He believes AI governance and ethical and emotional decision-making are distinctly human strengths. Sethi knew driving AI innovation for the organization and employees required cutting edge technology. Critical to this AI journey was unlocking capabilities with Workday AI and Workday-acquired Paradox.\n\n## Automating the manual, augmenting the human.\n\nThe company streamlined two unique cases with AI-powered conversational recruiting software from Paradox.       "title": "Why Human Connection Is the Missing Link in AI",
      "content": "Make work deeply experiential, helping people understand the “why,” not just the “what”\n Keep work social, encouraging collaboration and shared problem-solving\n Support work that is deliberately developmental, building skills over time\n\nWhen AI applications are designed this way, you can mitigate the risks and maximize the opportunity for human growth.\n\n## AI as a Connector to Relationships and Opportunities\n\nAt Workday, some of the most successful AI initiatives were shared experiences: prompt-a-thons, games, team challenges, and town halls where employees tell their own AI stories. [...] There’s a lot of enthusiasm around what AI can do for work: faster answers, greater efficiency, new levels of productivity. In equal measure, there’s an underlying question: Are we designing workplaces that bring us together, or pull us further apart?\n\nThis tension guided a thoughtful conversation on the Future of Work podcast between Workday Chief Learning Officer Chris Ernst and Chief Philanthropy Officer Carrie Varoquiers. The two discussed how the real opportunity isn't just using AI to help us do more, it’s using AI to help us connect more.\n\nReport\n\n### Workday Voice of the Employee: Addressing Burnout Risk\n\nRead Now\n\n## Loneliness Isn’t a Soft Problem [...] # Why Human Connection Is the Missing Link in AI\n\nWorkday’s Chris Ernst and Carrie Varoquiers explain why intentional design is the key to making AI a catalyst, not a deterrent, for connection and innovation.\n\nEmily Faracca\n\nMultimedia Content Writer\n\nWorkday\n\nIn this article\n\nJanuary 27, 2026   15 min listen\n\n4.       "url": "https://www.hrdive.com/news/companies-miss-hiring-goals-ai-goodtime/810590/",
      "title": "90% of US companies say they missed their hiring goals in ...",
      "content": "### Dive Insight:\n\nThe hiring market is under an “unprecedented strain,” GoodTime researchers said, with 60% of organizations seeing time-to-hire increase in 2025, and only 1 in 9 companies saying they had reduced time-to-hire. Likewise, a June report from Robert Half found that 93% of hiring managers said the hiring process took longer in 2025 than just two years ago.\n\nThe report from GoodTime outlined what kind of AI use in hiring could be useful to recruiters. Top-performing TA teams reorganized roles and workflows around AI instead of adding recruiters or relying on top-of-funnel automation, per the report. [...] ### Dive Brief:\n\n Ninety percent of U.S. companies said they missed their hiring goals, with 1 in 3 reporting they missed those goals by a wide margin, according to the fifth annual Hiring Insights Report from recruiting software company GoodTime.\n The independent study, which surveyed more than 500 U.S. talent acquisition leaders at companies with more than 1,000 employees in November 2025, found that recruiters spend 38% of their time scheduling interviews, meaning “scheduling remains the biggest operational tax on hiring,” per the report.\n While 99.8% of TA teams said they either use or plan to use AI agents, the report noted an uptick in “fraudulent” or AI-assisted candidates — making fraud the most anticipated hiring challenge in 2026.\n\n### Dive Insight: [...] ## Company Announcements\n\nView all | Post a press release\n\nTuition.io Launches “Quick Start” Student Loan Wellness Solution to Protect Employers from Imp…\n\nFrom Tuition.io\n\nJanuary 27, 2026 PerkSpot Enhances Its Employee Discount Solution with Launch of New Travel Booking Portal Powe…\n\nFrom HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions)\n\nJanuary 27, 2026 HR Consulting Firm Assessment Technologies Group Rebrands as QubitHR\n\nFrom QubitHR\n\nJanuary 13, 2026 Benepass Raises $40M Series B to Help Employers Redesign Benefits for Rising Healthcare Costs\n\nFrom Benepass\n\nJanuary 21, 2026\n\nEditors' picks\n\n Opinion\n\n  ### FLSA misclassification is common, costly and completely avoidable\n\n  Compliance can be easy, writes Jones Walker partner Sid Lewis, but employers too often fall asleep at the wheel.",

This can make it easier for auditors to trace how AI outputs are reviewed before they affect patients or regulatory submissions. Success will also likely depend on centralizing and standardizing core business processes to enable scalable AI solutions in what has traditionally been a highly decentralized sector. The gap between leaders and laggards will likely compound over time as data and processes mature, as talent grows, and as organizational learning expands. This could also accelerate consolidation as companies that lack the resources needed to build comprehensive AI capabilities become acquisition targets. A key determinant of success might be the ability to balance speed with responsibility. Companies should try to move fast enough to avoid competitive obsolescence while maintaining governance rigor that ensures patient safety, data privacy, and regulatory compliance.       "content": "Adopt a broad perspective: CISOs should encourage boards of directors to view cyber risk management as an integral component of the organization’s mission and financial strategy.\n Implement a structured reporting framework: Effective communication relies on comprehensive annual reports, regular quarterly updates, and ongoing operational reporting to provide a multidimensional view of the organization’s cybersecurity posture.\n Track both short- and long-term objectives: Quarterly and operational reports should monitor progress toward risk reduction, prevention, and resilience, while annual reports assess program effectiveness and strategic alignment. [...] As used in this article, “Deloitte” means Deloitte & Touche LLP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of our legal structure. Certain services may not be available to attest clients under the rules and regulations of public accounting.\n\nCopyright © 2026 Deloitte Development LLC. All rights reserved. [...] ### Part 3: A CISO’s blueprint for board reporting\n\nIn today’s rapidly evolving threat landscape, cybersecurity is no longer a purely technical concern. It is a critical business risk that requires strategic oversight from the board of directors. This issue provides chief information security officers (CISOs) with guidance on developing board reporting practices that align cybersecurity initiatives with broader enterprise objectives. By bridging the gap between technical complexity and strategic governance, board members gain the insights needed to oversee how emerging cyberthreats can be managed—and even leveraged—to drive growth, innovation, and competitive advantage.\n\n### Quick take: Board reporting leading practices",
      "score": 0.011815436,

    {
      "url": "https://www.zdnet.com/article/future-of-gmail-ai-interview-blake-barnes/",
      "title": "Inside Google's vision to make Gmail your personal AI ...",
      "content": "Also: 10 ways AI can inflict unprecedented damage in 2026\n\nIf there's something hot, that changes my pacing. As soon as I do the most minimal of morning prep, I'll sit myself down at the computer to deal with whatever is breaking. If there's nothing on fire, I know I can have a leisurely wake-up and morning prep, gently easing into my workday.\n\nNot everyone has my morning threat-assessment ritual. But there are roughly three billion (yes, billion) people who use Gmail. There are billions of people who, like me, spend hours each day in the app, managing their lives. There are billions of people for whom Gmail is, quite literally, the central dashboard of their lives. [...] ## Email is more than just email\n\nLast week, when I covered Gmail's new AI features, I was somewhat disappointed. Some of the features announced weren't available to me. Some were features I just didn't see myself using. Some features I tried produced errors, as AI often does.\n\nBut my discussion with Barnes course-corrected my interpretation.\n\nAlso: I used 20 Gemini prompts to find the cheapest flight possible - here's what happened\n\nGmail's AI update isn't just about the ability to summarize a thread or draft a reply. Those features are now basic table stakes in anything that can make an AI API call. What's interesting is that Google is on a path where it is trying to redefine and refine what an inbox can do for you. [...] He said it is trying to stay focused on the problems that a lot of us experience day to day. The world is busy, there's lots going on, there's lots to juggle, and there's lots of life management tasks to handle, whether that's traveling, whether that's communicating with friends and family, or whether it's working through errands.\n\nAlso:I let Gemini Deep Research dig through my Gmail and Drive - here's what it uncovered\n\nEssentially, Google is working on the premise that if email sits at the center of work and personal logistics, then the inbox can't just remain a passive stream.\n\nHe told me, \"Ultimately, all of these things ladder up to the vision of trying to help people to manage their life and not just their messages.\"\n\n## Moving from sorting to interpretation",
      "score": 0.22220221,
      "raw_content": null

      "title": "5 minutes with New York Life's CHRO",
      "content": "We’re very fortunate. Our CEO is very forward-thinking and really sees the power of AI. What I would say for leaders who maybe don’t have that buy in is “keep pushing,” because AI is here and it is guaranteed to stay. \n\nYou have to get the tools in people’s hands. Start small if you need to. Give a subset of people those tools and then really prove out that there is excitement and engagement around that. \n\nI go back to this concept of mindset. This is not deploying a technology tool; this is deploying a whole new way of thinking and working. \n\n#### What are you excited about on the HR front? [...] #### What are you excited about on the HR front?\n\nI don’t want to be repetitive, but everything is all AI. As a leader, I have to come up with a three-year strategic plan of how we’re going to leverage AI in HR. It’s really exciting capitalizing on some of the momentum that’s in our organization but also thinking about how we can reimagine some of the work and think big and think differently. \n\n#### What are you interested in outside of work?\n\nI love music.       "content": "### Dive Insight:\n\nThe hiring market is under an “unprecedented strain,” GoodTime researchers said, with 60% of organizations seeing time-to-hire increase in 2025, and only 1 in 9 companies saying they had reduced time-to-hire. Likewise, a June report from Robert Half found that 93% of hiring managers said the hiring process took longer in 2025 than just two years ago.\n\nThe report from GoodTime outlined what kind of AI use in hiring could be useful to recruiters. Top-performing TA teams reorganized roles and workflows around AI instead of adding recruiters or relying on top-of-funnel automation, per the report. [...] ### Dive Brief:\n\n Ninety percent of U.S. companies said they missed their hiring goals, with 1 in 3 reporting they missed those goals by a wide margin, according to the fifth annual Hiring Insights Report from recruiting software company GoodTime.\n The independent study, which surveyed more than 500 U.S. talent acquisition leaders at companies with more than 1,000 employees in November 2025, found that recruiters spend 38% of their time scheduling interviews, meaning “scheduling remains the biggest operational tax on hiring,” per the report.\n While 99.8% of TA teams said they either use or plan to use AI agents, the report noted an uptick in “fraudulent” or AI-assisted candidates — making fraud the most anticipated hiring challenge in 2026.\n\n### Dive Insight: [...] ## Company Announcements\n\nView all | Post a press release\n\nTuition.io Launches “Quick Start” Student Loan Wellness Solution to Protect Employers from Imp…\n\nFrom Tuition.io\n\nJanuary 27, 2026 PerkSpot Enhances Its Employee Discount Solution with Launch of New Travel Booking Portal Powe…\n\nFrom HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions)\n\nJanuary 27, 2026 HR Consulting Firm Assessment Technologies Group Rebrands as QubitHR\n\nFrom QubitHR\n\nJanuary 13, 2026 Benepass Raises $40M Series B to Help Employers Redesign Benefits for Rising Healthcare Costs\n\nFrom Benepass\n\nJanuary 21, 2026\n\nEditors' picks\n\n Opinion\n\n  ### FLSA misclassification is common, costly and completely avoidable\n\n  Compliance can be easy, writes Jones Walker partner Sid Lewis, but employers too often fall asleep at the wheel.",

    {
      "url": "https://venturebeat.com/technology/the-ai-visualization-tech-stack-from-2d-to-holograms",
      "title": "The AI visualization tech stack: From 2D to holograms",
      "content": "Further, there’s no onboarding friction with a hologram. No special equipment is required — simply walk into the light field and you see the hologram. There’s none of the discomfort or isolation that comes with wearable devices. Everyone can see the hologram together, immediately.\n\n## When to choose holograms\n\nThere are many situations where humans need to act with spatial intelligence. When alone, individual mediums like screens and AR/VR are great solutions and should be the first choice. But when there are high stakes, when discussion, collaboration, and trust between people are paramount, nothing can approach the value that holographics bring to the table. [...] #### 1. The 2D screen: the precision desktop\n\nThe 2D screen has been the reliable workhorse since spatial computing started and continues to be the primary interface, with most professional work still happening here. For a developer training a model or a single user doing 3D modeling, the 2D screen is great for the individual contributor. However, using a 2D screen forces a “3D-to-2D” mental translation, where the user has to keep the model in their mind, rotating, zooming, and interacting with this specific corner of the spatial world. The cognitive load of this mental model can cause the brain to work overtime to understand it.\n\n#### 2. VR: the immersive workspace [...] #### 2. VR: the immersive workspace\n\nVR offers that first jump beyond 2D. By completely immersing yourself in the 3D world, you gain a capability that is accessible and effective. When training a robotic system, being in the place of the autonomous system, helping that system by showing the human movement and training the system, VR is the place to be. But you are inherently by yourself. Even with avatars, you’ve lost touch with reality; only the digital world exists.\n\n#### 3. AR: the expert in your ear",
      "score": 0.0501304,
      "raw_content": null

      "url": "https://www.hrdive.com/news/5-minutes-with-new-york-lifes-chro-joanne-rodgers/810488/",
      "title": "5 minutes with New York Life's CHRO",
      "content": "#### What are you excited about on the HR front?\n\nI don’t want to be repetitive, but everything is all AI. As a leader, I have to come up with a three-year strategic plan of how we’re going to leverage AI in HR. It’s really exciting capitalizing on some of the momentum that’s in our organization but also thinking about how we can reimagine some of the work and think big and think differently. \n\n#### What are you interested in outside of work?\n\nI love music. I love live music. I like going to concerts. I’m getting my lineup ready for this year. [...] #### HR DIVE: How is the role of HR changing?\n\nJOANNE RODGERS: Now is the greatest time to be in HR, because I feel like there is so much going on around transformational work, whether or not that’s related to AI or evolving how organizations operate. HR is really front and center. I’ve seen a shift where we were always a partner, but now we are really driving thought leadership in many spaces. We’re ultimately driving business outcomes. \n\n#### What is your approach to leading change?\n\nWhen you think about any organizational change, it really is about people, and I really think it's about preparing them with the mindset, skill set and tool set. \n\n#### Do you have any advice for other organizations on AI adoption? [...] We’re very fortunate. Our CEO is very forward-thinking and really sees the power of AI. What I would say for leaders who maybe don’t have that buy in is “keep pushing,” because AI is here and it is guaranteed to stay. \n\nYou have to get the tools in people’s hands. Start small if you need to. Give a subset of people those tools and then really prove out that there is excitement and engagement around that. \n\nI go back to this concept of mindset. This is not deploying a technology tool; this is deploying a whole new way of thinking and working. \n\n#### What are you excited about on the HR front?",

      "title": "90% of US companies say they missed their hiring goals in ...",
      "content": "### Dive Insight:\n\nThe hiring market is under an “unprecedented strain,” GoodTime researchers said, with 60% of organizations seeing time-to-hire increase in 2025, and only 1 in 9 companies saying they had reduced time-to-hire. Likewise, a June report from Robert Half found that 93% of hiring managers said the hiring process took longer in 2025 than just two years ago.\n\nThe report from GoodTime outlined what kind of AI use in hiring could be useful to recruiters. Top-performing TA teams reorganized roles and workflows around AI instead of adding recruiters or relying on top-of-funnel automation, per the report. [...] ### Dive Brief:\n\n Ninety percent of U.S. companies said they missed their hiring goals, with 1 in 3 reporting they missed those goals by a wide margin, according to the fifth annual Hiring Insights Report from recruiting software company GoodTime.\n The independent study, which surveyed more than 500 U.S. talent acquisition leaders at companies with more than 1,000 employees in November 2025, found that recruiters spend 38% of their time scheduling interviews, meaning “scheduling remains the biggest operational tax on hiring,” per the report.\n While 99.8% of TA teams said they either use or plan to use AI agents, the report noted an uptick in “fraudulent” or AI-assisted candidates — making fraud the most anticipated hiring challenge in 2026.\n\n### Dive Insight: [...] ## Company Announcements\n\nView all | Post a press release\n\nTuition.io Launches “Quick Start” Student Loan Wellness Solution to Protect Employers from Imp…\n\nFrom Tuition.io\n\nJanuary 27, 2026 PerkSpot Enhances Its Employee Discount Solution with Launch of New Travel Booking Portal Powe…\n\nFrom HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions)\n\nJanuary 27, 2026 HR Consulting Firm Assessment Technologies Group Rebrands as QubitHR\n\nFrom QubitHR\n\nJanuary 13, 2026 Benepass Raises $40M Series B to Help Employers Redesign Benefits for Rising Healthcare Costs\n\nFrom Benepass\n\nJanuary 21, 2026\n\nEditors' picks\n\n Opinion\n\n  ### FLSA misclassification is common, costly and completely avoidable\n\n  Compliance can be easy, writes Jones Walker partner Sid Lewis, but employers too often fall asleep at the wheel.",

    {
      "url": "https://venturebeat.com/technology/the-ai-visualization-tech-stack-from-2d-to-holograms",
      "title": "The AI visualization tech stack: From 2D to holograms",
      "content": "#### 1. The 2D screen: the precision desktop\n\nThe 2D screen has been the reliable workhorse since spatial computing started and continues to be the primary interface, with most professional work still happening here. For a developer training a model or a single user doing 3D modeling, the 2D screen is great for the individual contributor. However, using a 2D screen forces a “3D-to-2D” mental translation, where the user has to keep the model in their mind, rotating, zooming, and interacting with this specific corner of the spatial world. The cognitive load of this mental model can cause the brain to work overtime to understand it.\n\n#### 2. VR: the immersive workspace [...] The first use cases are those in which the consequences of a bad decision are life-threatening, typically in medical and defence applications. The cognitive load and side effects of individual solutions are too much to accept in these situations. But physical AI is quickly encroaching into these high-consequence areas. Autonomous systems are driving our cars, running our factories, and are moving into these high-consequence areas that already demand human-in-the-loop decisions. Holograms allow teams to use their own spatial reasoning to identify simulation-to-reality gaps that may be invisible in other mediums.\n\n## The future of the visualization stack [...] Wally Haas is president of Avalon Holographics.\n\nSponsored articles are content produced by a company that is either paying for the post or has a business relationship with VentureBeat, and they’re always clearly marked. For more information, contact sales@venturebeat.com.\n\n## More",

      "title": "Enterprise AI Convergence Architecture",
      "content": "Traditional silos hinder real-time action keeping valuable insights trapped in dashboards,  and creating a gap between knowledge and action.\n AI convergence architecture unifies intelligence and operations by linking insights to execution and making intelligence actionable across the business.\n A layered, iterative approach meets brownfield reality by integrating convergence architecture through overlays, AI-native redesigns, and software as a services (SaaS), enabling gradual modernization without disruption.\n Closed-loop intelligence fuels organizational learning, ensuring that every action generates feedback, continually enhancing insights and helping organizations learn, adapt, and act dynamically. [...] Convergence architecture helps retailers move from batch-driven to adaptive commerce. It connects legacy ERP and merchandising with AI to deliver real-time omnichannel inventory and flexible fulfillment, reduce stockouts and markdowns, and improve supplier collaboration and dynamic merchandising through trend sensing, forecasting, and SaaS/API integrations.\n\n# Converging on the future [...] # Converging on the future\n\nThe era of convergence architecture marks a pivotal turning point, enabling organizations to transcend traditional system management and evolve into truly thinking, learning, and acting enterprises. By weaving connective intelligence fabrics, embedding robust governance, and selectively investing in transformational redesigns, organizations can unlock the full potential of AI and agents, creating seamless, closed-loop intelligence where every insight drives smarter action, and every action fuels continuous learning.\n\nDownload our complete guide\n\n### The Deloitte AI Institute",

      "title": "90% of US companies say they missed their hiring goals in ...",
      "content": "### Dive Insight:\n\nThe hiring market is under an “unprecedented strain,” GoodTime researchers said, with 60% of organizations seeing time-to-hire increase in 2025, and only 1 in 9 companies saying they had reduced time-to-hire. Likewise, a June report from Robert Half found that 93% of hiring managers said the hiring process took longer in 2025 than just two years ago.\n\nThe report from GoodTime outlined what kind of AI use in hiring could be useful to recruiters. Top-performing TA teams reorganized roles and workflows around AI instead of adding recruiters or relying on top-of-funnel automation, per the report. [...] ### Dive Brief:\n\n Ninety percent of U.S. companies said they missed their hiring goals, with 1 in 3 reporting they missed those goals by a wide margin, according to the fifth annual Hiring Insights Report from recruiting software company GoodTime.\n The independent study, which surveyed more than 500 U.S. talent acquisition leaders at companies with more than 1,000 employees in November 2025, found that recruiters spend 38% of their time scheduling interviews, meaning “scheduling remains the biggest operational tax on hiring,” per the report.\n While 99.8% of TA teams said they either use or plan to use AI agents, the report noted an uptick in “fraudulent” or AI-assisted candidates — making fraud the most anticipated hiring challenge in 2026.\n\n### Dive Insight: [...] ## Company Announcements\n\nView all | Post a press release\n\nTuition.io Launches “Quick Start” Student Loan Wellness Solution to Protect Employers from Imp…\n\nFrom Tuition.io\n\nJanuary 27, 2026 PerkSpot Enhances Its Employee Discount Solution with Launch of New Travel Booking Portal Powe…\n\nFrom HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions)\n\nJanuary 27, 2026 HR Consulting Firm Assessment Technologies Group Rebrands as QubitHR\n\nFrom QubitHR\n\nJanuary 13, 2026 Benepass Raises $40M Series B to Help Employers Redesign Benefits for Rising Healthcare Costs\n\nFrom Benepass\n\nJanuary 21, 2026\n\nEditors' picks\n\n Opinion\n\n  ### FLSA misclassification is common, costly and completely avoidable\n\n  Compliance can be easy, writes Jones Walker partner Sid Lewis, but employers too often fall asleep at the wheel.",

      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/us/en/Industries/life-sciences-health-care/blogs/health-care/three-key-trends-likely-to-shape-medtech.html",
      "title": "Three Key Trends Likely to Shape Medtech in 2026",
      "content": "The medtech industry is witnessing a transformative shift as AI becomes integral to innovation and operational strategies (see Can agentic AI improve workflows and margins in medtech?). AI can be more than a technology investment. It can be a core capability that can drive advancements across the organization. Many medtech companies are embedding AI across their operations, transforming how they deliver care and how they operate their businesses. However, execution and adoption across the industry remains uneven, with significant challenges in data quality, regulatory compliance, and change management.vii As such, some industry leaders are focusing on investments in critical enablers first—including data governance, talent, and robust processes—to establish a strong foundation to fully [...] auditable. An effective AI strategy should include clear problem statements, explicit regulatory and privacy inputs, documented verification and validation protocols, and formalized human roles. This can make it easier for auditors to trace how AI outputs are reviewed before they affect patients or regulatory submissions. Success will also likely depend on centralizing and standardizing core business processes to enable scalable AI solutions in what has traditionally been a highly decentralized sector. Treating data as a governed and shared asset, solving interoperability and ownership issues, and partnering with big tech on infrastructure—while keeping sensitive data inside the organization’s walls—could be important for effectively and compliantly scaling the use of AI and other [...] Latest news from @DeloitteHealth\n\nEndnotes\n\niBased on a Deloitte analysis of data from Evaluate Medtech-medical device insights  \niiQ3 2025 medtech licensing and venture report, J.P.       "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/us/en/Industries/life-sciences-health-care/blogs/health-care/three-key-trends-likely-to-shape-medtech.html",
      "title": "Three Key Trends Likely to Shape Medtech in 2026",
      "content": "The medtech industry is witnessing a transformative shift as AI becomes integral to innovation and operational strategies (see Can agentic AI improve workflows and margins in medtech?). AI can be more than a technology investment. It can be a core capability that can drive advancements across the organization. Many medtech companies are embedding AI across their operations, transforming how they deliver care and how they operate their businesses. However, execution and adoption across the industry remains uneven, with significant challenges in data quality, regulatory compliance, and change management.vii As such, some industry leaders are focusing on investments in critical enablers first—including data governance, talent, and robust processes—to establish a strong foundation to fully [...] auditable. An effective AI strategy should include clear problem statements, explicit regulatory and privacy inputs, documented verification and validation protocols, and formalized human roles. This can make it easier for auditors to trace how AI outputs are reviewed before they affect patients or regulatory submissions. Success will also likely depend on centralizing and standardizing core business processes to enable scalable AI solutions in what has traditionally been a highly decentralized sector. Treating data as a governed and shared asset, solving interoperability and ownership issues, and partnering with big tech on infrastructure—while keeping sensitive data inside the organization’s walls—could be important for effectively and compliantly scaling the use of AI and other [...] Latest news from @DeloitteHealth\n\nEndnotes\n\niBased on a Deloitte analysis of data from Evaluate Medtech-medical device insights  \niiQ3 2025 medtech licensing and venture report, J.P. Medtronic set a goal to automate 80% of HR processes. “We can advance the way we provide service to our organization by embedding AI into nearly all the processes that we run for HR,” says Sethi. [...] Paramount to this vision is that it is human-led. For Sethi, AI is a companion, but will never be a human replacement.       "content": "Make work deeply experiential, helping people understand the “why,” not just the “what”\n Keep work social, encouraging collaboration and shared problem-solving\n Support work that is deliberately developmental, building skills over time\n\nWhen AI applications are designed this way, you can mitigate the risks and maximize the opportunity for human growth.\n\n## AI as a Connector to Relationships and Opportunities\n\nAt Workday, some of the most successful AI initiatives were shared experiences: prompt-a-thons, games, team challenges, and town halls where employees tell their own AI stories.       "title": "Governed AI Agents: How to Deploy and Scale with Confidence",
      "content": "## Centralized Registry\n\nWith the Agentstudio centralized registry, you can manage and govern all your agents from a single pane of glass, giving you the control, consistency, and confidence that AI is operating within your enterprise standards. Register agents from across your organization, no matter where they’re built, avoiding vendor lock-in and reducing security and compliance risks. Agentstudio supports more than 30 different custom providers such as CrewAI, Hugging Face, LangChain, n8n, OpenAI, ServiceNow, Workday, and growing. Easily list these agents by simply uploading documentation to Boomi’s auto-cataloging feature, with native support for AWS Bedrock, Agentforce, Microsoft Copilot, and Snowflake.\n\n## Audit Logs [...] en-flag\nfr-flag\nde-flag\nit-flag\nja-flag\nBoomi Enterprise Platform\nWhy Boomi\nPricing\nSecurity & Compliance\nInnovation\nBoomi Embedded\nIntegration & Automation\nFlow\nEvent Streams\nB2B/EDI Management\nTask Automation\nManaged File Transfer\nData Management\nData Hub\nData Integration\nAPI Management\nAPI Governance\nAPI Security\nAPI Products\nBoomi AI\nBoomi Agentstudio\nAI Agents\nBoomi MCP\nResponsible AI\nBoomi for SAP\nAWS\nSalesforce\nServiceNow\nOracle NetSuite\nSlack\nWorkday\nStripe\nExplore Boomi Marketplace\nConnect Any Application\nConnect with NetSuite\nConnect with Snowflake\nConnect with ChatGPT\nConnect with ServiceNow\nConnect with Shopify\nConnect with Google Drive\nRetrieval-Augmented Generation with Boomi\nManufacturing\nHealthcare and Life Sciences\nRetail\nFinancial Services\nHigher Education\nPublic Sector [...] According to the ISG Buyers Guides™ for Data Integration and Master Data Management 2025, Boomi is an Exemplary Vendor in Data Integration and Master Data Management — earning multiple Leader rankings across product capability, customer experience, and ROI delivery.\n\n## Boomi Named a Leader in 2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for API Management\n\nGartner® positioned Boomi as a Leader in the Magic Quadrant™ for API Management published in October 2025.\n\n## Boomi Agentstudio\n\nSimply design, govern, and orchestrate all AI agents at scale to unlock hyperproductivity responsibly.\n\nBoomi for SAP\nAWS\nSalesforce\nServiceNow\nOracle NetSuite\nSlack\nWorkday\nStripe",

    {
      "url": "https://venturebeat.com/technology/the-ai-visualization-tech-stack-from-2d-to-holograms",
      "title": "The AI visualization tech stack: From 2D to holograms",
      "content": "#### 2. VR: the immersive workspace\n\nVR offers that first jump beyond 2D. By completely immersing yourself in the 3D world, you gain a capability that is accessible and effective. When training a robotic system, being in the place of the autonomous system, helping that system by showing the human movement and training the system, VR is the place to be. But you are inherently by yourself. Even with avatars, you’ve lost touch with reality; only the digital world exists.\n\n#### 3. AR: the expert in your ear [...] ## The power of the shared physical context\n\nThe true value of the holographic display in the era of physical AI lies in the ability to solve the referential ambiguity problem. In a holographic environment, the light rays are physically reconstructed. Multiple people look at the same reconstruction from individual perspectives; if I point at a joint in a humanoid robot, a cancerous tumour, cover versus concealment, there’s no ambiguity about what I am pointing at. Everyone knows EXACTLY what I’m pointing at. This shared experience, where I can see you, your full reaction, and you can see mine, creates a level of trust that no other medium can match. [...] #### 1. The 2D screen: the precision desktop\n\nThe 2D screen has been the reliable workhorse since spatial computing started and continues to be the primary interface, with most professional work still happening here. For a developer training a model or a single user doing 3D modeling, the 2D screen is great for the individual contributor. However, using a 2D screen forces a “3D-to-2D” mental translation, where the user has to keep the model in their mind, rotating, zooming, and interacting with this specific corner of the spatial world. The cognitive load of this mental model can cause the brain to work overtime to understand it.\n\n#### 2. VR: the immersive workspace",

      "content": "|  |  |  |\n --- \n| Band | Relevant Income | Tax Rate |\n|  |  |  |\n --- \n| Personal Allowance | Up to £12,570 | 0 percent |\n| Starter | Above £12,570 to £16,537 | 19 percent |\n| Basic | Above £16,537 to £29,526 | 20 percent |\n| Intermediate | Above £29,526 to £43,662 | 21 percent |\n| Higher | Above £43,662 to £75,000 | 42 percent |\n| Advanced\\ | Above £75,000 to £125,140 | 45 percent |\n| Top | Above £125,140 | 48 percent |\n\nBand\n\nRelevant Income\n\nTax Rate\n\nPersonal Allowance\n\nUp to £12,570\n\n0 percent\n\nStarter\n\nAbove £12,570 to £16,537\n\n19 percent\n\nBasic\n\nAbove £16,537 to £29,526\n\n20 percent\n\nIntermediate\n\nAbove £29,526 to £43,662\n\n21 percent\n\nHigher\n\nAbove £43,662 to £75,000\n\n42 percent\n\nAdvanced\\\n\nAbove £75,000 to £125,140\n\n45 percent\n\nTop\n\nAbove £125,140\n\n48 percent [...] 45 percent\n\nTop\n\nAbove £125,140\n\n48 percent\n\nSource: KPMG LLP (U.K.)\n\n\\ The personal allowance reduces by £1 for every £2 of taxable income above £100,000.\n\n## How the Scottish Income Tax System Works\n\n#### Devolved Income-Tax-Setting Powers\n\nIncome tax is partially devolved in the U.K., with certain powers exercised by the Scottish Parliament in relation to Scottish taxpayers (see below), and all other income-tax powers exercised by the U.K. Parliament in relation to all U.K.-resident individuals.4\n\nScottish taxpayers are entitled to an income-tax-free Personal Allowance set by the U.K. Parliament (subject to their personal circumstances), and are subject to tax on savings income (i.e., interest) and dividends based on the same bands and rates as other individual U.K. taxpayers. [...] ### WHY THIS MATTERS\n\nThe U.K. tax authorities (HMRC) will notify employers of the ‘Scottish taxpayer’ status of their employees for most payroll withholding purposes. However, employers that operate Appendix 6 modified payroll agreements for tax-equalised expatriates might need to determine whether individuals included in a modified payroll scheme are Scottish taxpayers based on the applicable statutory tests, relevant facts, and HMRC’s published guidance on Scottish taxpayer status and apply the relevant Scottish rates where appropriate.3\n\nEmployers may also need to take account of Scottish rates of income tax when calculating the tax due under a ‘pay as you earn’ (PAYE) Settlement Agreement to pay income tax on employees’ behalf on minor or irregular benefits.",
      "score": 0.023909599,
      "raw_content": null

      "content": "## The human side of digital change.\n\nThe greatest push for this AI future started on the HR side with Workday Human Capital Management with the intent to transform the employee journey from hiring to development and departure. Medtronic set a goal to automate 80% of HR processes. “We can advance the way we provide service to our organization by embedding AI into nearly all the processes that we run for HR,” says Sethi. [...] ## The human side of digital change.\n\nThe greatest push for this AI future started on the HR side with Workday Human Capital Management with the intent to transform the employee journey from hiring to development and departure. Medtronic set a goal to automate 80% of HR processes. “We can advance the way we provide service to our organization by embedding AI into nearly all the processes that we run for HR,” says Sethi. [...] Paramount to this vision is that it is human-led. For Sethi, AI is a companion, but will never be a human replacement. He believes AI governance and ethical and emotional decision-making are distinctly human strengths. Sethi knew driving AI innovation for the organization and employees required cutting edge technology. Critical to this AI journey was unlocking capabilities with Workday AI and Workday-acquired Paradox.\n\n## Automating the manual, augmenting the human.\n\nThe company streamlined two unique cases with AI-powered conversational recruiting software from Paradox. Firstly, using the conversational ‘chat to apply’ feature to allow candidates to easily submit an application into Workday without navigating the complexities of a traditional talent management system.",

    {
      "url": "https://www.workday.com/en-us/perspectives/hr/crisis-of-connection.html",
      "title": "Why Human Connection Is the Missing Link in AI",
      "content": "Make work deeply experiential, helping people understand the “why,” not just the “what”\n Keep work social, encouraging collaboration and shared problem-solving\n Support work that is deliberately developmental, building skills over time\n\nWhen AI applications are designed this way, you can mitigate the risks and maximize the opportunity for human growth.\n\n## AI as a Connector to Relationships and Opportunities\n\nAt Workday, some of the most successful AI initiatives were shared experiences: prompt-a-thons, games, team challenges, and town halls where employees tell their own AI stories. [...] There’s a lot of enthusiasm around what AI can do for work: faster answers, greater efficiency, new levels of productivity. In equal measure, there’s an underlying question: Are we designing workplaces that bring us together, or pull us further apart?\n\nThis tension guided a thoughtful conversation on the Future of Work podcast between Workday Chief Learning Officer Chris Ernst and Chief Philanthropy Officer Carrie Varoquiers. The two discussed how the real opportunity isn't just using AI to help us do more, it’s using AI to help us connect more.\n\nReport\n\n### Workday Voice of the Employee: Addressing Burnout Risk\n\nRead Now\n\n## Loneliness Isn’t a Soft Problem [...] # Why Human Connection Is the Missing Link in AI\n\nWorkday’s Chris Ernst and Carrie Varoquiers explain why intentional design is the key to making AI a catalyst, not a deterrent, for connection and innovation.\n\nEmily Faracca\n\nMultimedia Content Writer\n\nWorkday\n\nIn this article\n\nJanuary 27, 2026   15 min listen\n\n4. Your inbox is clear, your reports are generated in seconds, and your AI assistant has scheduled your entire week. By every traditional metric of productivity, you’ve won. But perhaps, despite your cleared to-do list, you feel a nagging sense of isolation. You’ve had fifty digital interactions today, but not a single human connection.",
